text: Bottle from local AH @home. Really refreshing. Very good try of this bigger brewer. Taste directions good IPA. Citrus, herbs, fruity. Price/quality very good, especially in bonus ðŸ˜„

33 cL Bottle at home. Pours slightly hazy golden with a large white head. Awesome aroma with lots of grassy hops, hay, some grain and citrus. Taste is clean and crisp with lots of grassy hops and a medium bitter finish. Light to medium body, medium carbo. Very nice stuff, might even be better than Up.

F: medium size, egg-white, good retention.
C: gold, hazy.
A: malty, grassy, citrus, bit of fresh cannabis leaves, orange, pine resin.
T: malty, grassy, orange, light different tropical fruits, tangerine, medium body, medium carbonation, very nice, enjoyed, 30cl bottle from Jumbo in Marknesse in Netherland.
Bevuta alla spina! Buona birra! Alla Bevuta rimane molto fresca con unÂ’ottima luppolatura!

Bottle. A little cloudy golden color, small fine white head. A bit weak aroma, fresh, spicy, a little malty. Dry taste, high bitterness. Medium to thin texture, low carbonation. Spicy, herbal aftertaste, with a quite strong bitterness.
voor een lager lekker hoppig in aroma en smaak goed alternatief voor de comerciele pilsner,maar naar mij smaak te zacht en flauw zeg maar een goede pils hop

A light fruity smell, a little bit sweet (vanilla). The small white foamy head has a normal duration, the body is dark yellow. A light bitter taste, a little bit malty, the finish is quite long and bitter. The body is light, very creamy with a normal carbonation.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, fruit, grain, bread and hops.

Appearance:

Turbid golden/amber beer with heavy yeast and with a slight/medium white/off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with grain, bread and hops.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. This is especially true for its style. Very refreshing and well brewed. Nothing else to say really, just a good beer overall.

Bottle shared at Borefts Beer Festival 7th edition day 1 25/09/2016. Many thanks! A light hazed golden yellow coloured pout with a halo of white head. Aroma is simple base grains, floral hop, little tea leaves. Flavour is composed of base grains, little orange rind, citrus oil, little vanilla. Palate is semi sweet , moderate carbonation, ok.
Volgens mark de beste prijs kwaliteit. Inderdaad best lekker hoppig. Prima! . .

Tap: Deep golden, hazy, cream off-white head, moderate to solid herbal to piney hoppy nose, delicate pale- malty traces from far behind; moderate to solid bitter-sweet flavour, not too dry, light to medium bodied, both fizzy and smooth; lingering hoppy and sweet malty finish. Chapeau! A gem, absolutely unexpected

Barwa sÅ‚omkowa, zamglona, od gÃ³ry piwo zamyka czapa Å›nieÅ¼nobiaÅ‚ej, gÄ™stej, kremowej piany, ktÃ³ra dÅ‚ugo nie redukuje swojego rozmiaru.
Bardzo intensywny aromat przynosi owocowoÅ›Ä‡, karmel i mnÃ³stwo Å¼ywicy, jest lekki i rzeÅ›ki.
Smak podobnie jak aromat, czyli owoce, karmel i spora dawka Å¼ywicy, gdzieÅ› w tle pojawia siÄ™ ryÅ¼.
Goryczka niska - taka jest odczuwalna ale dÅ‚uga, nie Å›ciÄ…ga, pasuje. Wysycenie Å›rednie w kierunku wysokiego.
Uwagi: rewelacyjnie pijalne, zaskakujÄ…co rzeÅ›kie i ........ po prostu pyszne.

Weizenfarbenes, leicht trÃ¼bes Bier. Geruch hopfig, frisch, Ã¤hnlich wie bei einem IPA, allerdings mit einer starken Karamellnote. Geschmack ist aber kaum bitter, da Hopfenbittere und RestsÃ¼ÃŸe gut ausgewogen vorliegen. Etwas kratzig im Abgang.

Gelb/Orange, sehr trÃ¼b. Geruch vorsichtig C-Hopfig. Mit Melone und Ananas. Im Geschmack dann restsÃ¼ÃŸ und sehr rund. Eines der wenigen Zwickel, die richtig gut sind. Belegender Nachgeschmack, der ist nicht so gut.

(Draught at Arendsnest, Amsterdam, 16 Sep 2016) Golden amber colour with frothy, white head. Malty, fruity nose with notes of bread, grass and citrus. Malty, fruity taste with bread, grass, citrus, peaches, some tropical fruit and a balanced grassy, fruity bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Tasty and fairly straightforward. Quite enjoyable.
Tap at Arendsnest, 13th October 16. Pours light straw. Aroma is slight sour, lemon, sherbet. Taste is refreshing, some yeast, lemon peel, citrus, bitter. Good
Bottle @ Bonnefantenmuseum, Maastricht. Hazy yellow colour, white foam. Nose of tropical fruit. Very hoppy and fruity. A surprise!

Weicher, mild grasig-hopfiger Antrunk. Im Mittelteil spielt zusÃ¤tzlich eine deutliche Getreidigkeit mit, die aber von dem stÃ¤rker werdenden Hopfen sachte bei Seite geschoben wird. Harmonisch, geringe Bitterkeit, langer Nachhall, der primÃ¤r hopfig ist, Getreidenoten kommen hier aber auch wieder zum Vorschein. Ãœberraschend gut. 10/12/12/12/10/12

0,33l bottle at home. BB 11/2016. yellow almost clear color, small white head. smells of caramel, old hoppy, resin, parfumy. ok smell. medium to full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of candy, caramel, light resin notes, herbs, tobacco. finishes light to medium bitter with notes of some old hops, caramel and resin. Looks (or better tastes) like I got an old bottle. I think I got this one from Bier Navi. Probably would have been better when fresh.

Draft at Biergarten Rotterdam. Had a fresh one and one from the end of the keg, quite a difference. Fresh one was clear amber gold with stable head, the other yellow to amber with large sediments, looked like a Weizen. Aroma: nicely subdued hoppy aroma, mostly exotic fruits, carrot juice. Nice malt presence as well. Second one was a little more hop intense. Taste: very drinkable blonde with a gentle hoppy touch, very drinkable. Fresh one had a relatively crisp mouth feel, second one felt more like a hoppy weizen. Relatively dry finish for this style.

Draught at De Pilsner Club, Amsterdam. Hazy golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Malty bready aroma, biscuits, citrus, caramel, grapes, some grass. Malty bready flavor, citrus, caramel, grapes, hay notes, some biscuits. Quite ok.

Quite nice. Refreshing with a good hop caracter. Pale with a good white head and well carbonated. Flavor is malty with lots of hops. A bit grassy citrussy up front but quickly goes to a resinous strong element. Still it is quite sessionable.
[16/1/16] Bottle from AH in Amsterdam Oost. Nice golden body with medium head. Nose of fruits, malts some spices. Taste is hoppy, bitter with grains. Pretty good.
Bottle 33 cl. Pours orange with a medium but fading white head and an aroma of citrus, sweet malts, ripe fruits and herbs. The taste is medium sweet with a bitter finish thatÂ’s not that long.
Unfiltered yellow beer. DoesnÂ’t really taste like an IPA. Little carbonation, mediocre mouthfeel. A little spicy in the aftertaste. OK beer.

Draft 0.25l at Proeflokaal Arendsnest Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 03.06.2016. Taste with cika Boban. Pour it hazy golden color with medium white head.Aroma buttery, some corn. Taste starts with sweet frunky malty, some hops harsh one on the back. Not so terrific but ok.

Bottle at a tasting. Overall not a bad beer, just tying together very heterogenous elements. High bitterness, moderate diacetyl, also more residual sweetness than needed. Also the hoppiness is grassy/herbal. Does not work with me.

Bottle, Many thanks to RW80. Hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma is hops, bisquity malty. Lemon. Taste is nice hoppy, citrusy, with malty backbone. Nice bitterness. Very well balanced and drinkable. Good.

Bottle kindly shared by rusos, many thanks. Orange golden color with medium white head. Aroma of oranges, tangerines, light malt. Taste, solid a,lay backbone followed by light citrus hoppy bitterness with oranges, zest, pines. Good.

MÃ¶chte gern ein IPA sein, ist aber relativ flach auf den ersten Schluck. Eher etwas fÃ¼r Einsteiger dieses Bierstils, oder Leute, die gern ein leicht fruchtiges, frisches Sommerbier suchen. Quasi ein Saison, mit betont hopfigem Charakter. Als solches funktioniert das Ur-Hop tatsÃ¤chlich anstÃ¤ndig.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2016 Bottle. Turn the bottle before pouring so the yeast will pour in the glass along with the rest of your beer. Hazy golden color. Taste: Bitter, citrus, hint of herbs. Smooth. Long lasting aftertaste. Definitely one of the better hoppy beers in my opinion.

As IPL at sign. Pours golden small white head. Aroma: hoppy, grass, herbs, slight citrus, some maltiness. Taste: as a very good pilsner, sweet and bitter, nothing dominates. Thin + body. Nice beer.

Bottled from the AH.
Very tasteful beer with a nice and balanced flavour. A real nice and mellow beer for a sunny day. 
Aroma: citrus, herbs, grass, hay
Appearance: amber, hazy
Taste: light sweetness, medium bitterness
Palate: soft carbonation, medium body
For a big brewery IPA this one might be the most palatable. Bitter? Not really, but it has a little bite. Palate is nice.

Oranje/Amber kleur, witte schuimkraag die snel inzakt. Aromas zijn citrus/grapefruit, fruitig... Abrikoos en perzik en pijnboom. De smaak is fruitig, iets grassig moutig, een sinaasappelschil en een flinke hopbitter. De bitter blijft even hangen om daarna een zoete smaak achter te laten. Een redelijk romig dik mondgevoel, je ziet ook veel substantie in het glas dartelen...verrassend goed voor een relatief goedkoop biertje. Medoum koolzuur en lekker fris. Een goeie deze "India Pale Lager Landbier"!  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

33cl bottle from Sip, Tallinn. Pours slightly hazy deep golden to orange with a fairly small white head. Hoppy aroma, with grassy and herbal notes, tropical fruits, malt and hints of honey and oranges. Moderate to medium sweet with nice hoppy flavours and a balanced bitterness. Quit pleasant.
Hazy yellow beer, little frothy white head, which stays. Herbs and honey aroma and little bit hops.Medium sour and bitter. Slightly sweet. Overall interesting flavoured beer, not bad!

Bottle provided by Borresteijn. Thanks a lot. ItÂ’s a hazy orange beer with a creamy dense off white head. Earthy hoppy and citrusy aroma with a clean malty hint. Refreshingly hoppy flavor. Citrus, minerals and a good amount of malts. Nicely balanced lager.

Aroma: bread, grapefruit, honey. Appearance: golden, cloudy, rocky head, white foam, lasts well. Taste: medium sourness, light sweetness, lightly bitter (expected more bitterness). Palate: medium body, thin creamy feel, soft carbonation, medium bitter aftertaste.

Tolles Bier, aber ich habe es diverse Male 2014/15 getrunken und es war definitiv kein Zwickel, sondern ein India Pale Lager. Dieses war toll gehopft und schmeckte entspannt nach einem Pale Ale, war sehr sÃ¼ffig und dezent fruchtig herb. Aus Holland im abgelaufenen Six Pack fÃ¼r ca. 5 Euro. Klasse.

Golden yellow colour. Thin white hea. Peach, fruit tea, hints of citruses in the aroma. Peach, tea and some sweetnes at first. Swetness and hints also in the middle. Hoppy and rather bitter finish. Light bodied, medium carbonated, bit sweet, but otherwise really drinkable beer.

A delikate India Pale Lager. Funny. Hops is indicable but not without a responsible effort. That is a maalty lager with a selection of hops. Na otarcie Å‚ez firmowy kapselek do kolekcji ;)
haxy golden liquid with thick white head. aroma is soapy, spruce, hay, lemon. taste of grapefruit, hay. light body, light feel

India Pale Lager written on the label. Pours hazy golden with cascade aromas rising up. Pleasant fruity hop profile with noticeable bitterness level. Malty backbone is quite light, but perfectly suitable for a hoppy lager. Absolutely met my expectations. Tasty and refreshing.

Wazige strogeel bier met een wiite snelzakkende schuimkraag.
In de neus: citrus, gist, grazige hop. 
Smaak: matig bitter met een lichte, waterige, gist, grazige citrus hop palet. Gemiddeld mondgevoel met een gemiddelde koolzuur en een bittere afdronk.
Aroma is light hoppy. Hazy light amber color. Taste is nice combination of sweetness and bitterness, with a little dry aftertaste.

Bottle from Albert Heijn. poured a hazy straw colour with a frothy white head and some broken clingy lace. The aroma is citrus, yeast, grassy hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a light, watery, yeast, grassy citrus hop palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Drinkable, but not great.
Very good beer, also classified as Â’India Pale LagerÂ’. Rich and strong hoppy tones linger on from the start to the aftertaste.

33cl Bottle at home. Golden yellow hazy beer with a small white head.
Grainy, malty, hoppy, crisp. Nice carbo. Backlog from 2014/10/29.

25th September 2015Borefts VII. Day 1. Bottle share, thanks to ? Hazy gold beer, small white head. Palate is smooth, semi dry and has mild fine carbonation. German style nutty pale malts. Mild dried fruits. Little apricot. Light semi dry finish. Okay.

[9/25/15] Bottle shared at Borefts Beer Festival 2015 in Bodegraven. Thanks Countbeer for this bottle! Hazy golden. Grainy aroma. Sweetish grainy flavor with a bitter finish, a bit hoppy. Medium-bodied.
33cl Bottle at Deen supermarked. Dark golden. Big foamy head. Grassy smell. Lots of grapefuits. Very very nice one !

Bottle split at BBF 7, Bodegraven, 25/09/15. 
Very lightly hazed golden orange with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is caramel, malty tones, straw, biscuit, earthy.
Taste comprises bitter orange, straw, citric peel, bread dough, yeast, earthy ring.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
So so.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Aroma has grassy and sweet hops. Some fruitiness too. Sweet grassy and mildly fruity hops in taste. In fact, the hoppiness is pretty notable for the style, hence the high average score here. Sweet malty body. Good.

Bottle @ hop. IÂ’m pretty sure IÂ’ve had this one but I somehow didnÂ’t rate it. Then I bought a sixpack Ur-Pilsener because IÂ’m lazy when it comes to reading and double checking. Finally picked up a bottle now. Slightly hazy yellow with a fairly large white head. Smells quite hoppy and fresh, slightly fruity, quite nice. Tastes slightly hoppy, fresh, malts. Very nice for a Â’commercialÂ’ brew like this, whatever that implies. Thin to medium body, nice carbo.
Bottle Borefts 2015. Some lager malt some lemon. ItÂ’s one of their better beers bit still not a good lager

Iets bleek amber met witte kraag. Aroma van hop, fruitig, sinaasappel, lichte citrus. Smaken zijn redelijk bitter, licht zoet, beperkt fruitig, matige body, iets dun. Prima supermarkt ipa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle courtesy of and split with 77ships post Van Moll fest. 
BB 02/2016.
DorÃ©e, col crÃ©meux blanc.
ArÃ´me offre un bouquet modÃ©rÃ©, fleuri et fruitÃ© tirant sur les agrumes, le tout restant assez noble. Malt
Palais est maltÃ©, moyen, houblonnÃ© fin et sec avec une belle note citronnÃ©e et noble. Malt reste modÃ©rÃ© au caractÃ¨re pils, fini prÃ©sente une note fine de levure.
Golden with an off-white head. Aroma of citrus, malt, pine and flowers. Taste is bitter and mild sweet. Refreshing.

fles 30cl
KLeur geel/oranje, mooie schuimkraag
geur: citrus, gras, bloemen, hop
smaak: fris, kruidig en bitter, goed doordrinkbaar. Lekkere dorstlesser

330 ml. bottle sample @ train-ride post Oersoep / Van Moll Festival week-end with Sebletitje. Cheers! Purchased @ Albert Heijn. BBF 02/16. Hazy golden, creamy white. Nose is medicinal hops, fizzy, herbal, citrus, mineral, interesting. Taste is oily herbal, bitter, touch malty, pine resin oil, touch almost corn, tad sweetish, citrus, grass,Â… Very oily body. A very interesting hoppy lager that drinks quite well. The price is crazy low, I get the love for this one.
hay,floral, citrus, herbs, cannabis,a very strange very bitter beer worth a try.
Nice and easy drinkable beer. It has the typical organic gulpener beer taste, but than with a lot of hop! Bitter and sweet like honey...

Hazy golden amber, medium frothy white head. Nose is mild and sweet maltiness with citric notes, mango. Flavor is soft and full malt, some sweetness, nice and grapefruit-mango bitterness which is, again, pretty mild and soft, like the bitterness in the finish. Lingering grapefruity-herbal hops. Smooth, soft, very drinkable.

Bottle from local AH. Slightly hazy golden coloured, with an off white head. Nose is light grainy, grassy and slight citric hops. Flavour is light grainy, grasdy, slight sweetness, medium carbonation. Crisp and dry, decent hop bitterness. Very well drinkable.

330ml bottle. Slightly hazy amber color. Might be my mistake. Medium size, thick white head, stays. Sweet, malty, orange marmalade, faint minerals, juicy citrus in aroma. Perfume, sweet, floral hops, quite a lot of maltiness in taste. Nice hoppy bite in aftertaste. Well balanced. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Nice one.

0,33l bottle. Pours golden with whiteish head. The head doesnÂ’t stay. Aroma is hoppy, malt, honey, citrus. Flavor is sweet and bitter, malt, caramel, honey.toasty notes, and citrus. Finish is dry-fruity bitter. Overall: good.

Bottle. Hazy orange body with white head. Aroma is honey with pines in the background. Taste is nice grains with pines and herbs and also some honey. Aftertaste is malty with some nice hoppy background. Nice lager
Foamy foam white and bubbly. Murky light amber color. Grassy hop aroma. Balanced taste with strong bitterness.

Very good, dense, yellowish head over veiled orangeish golden beer. End of bottle solid yeast. Aromatic (C-)hopsÂ’ nose, bit resiny, pine. Bitter, but perfumey and fruity hops; citrus, banana, exotic fruit, grapes, lunaria. Finish sports quite some resrsugars. Some gristslickness, yeast-filled, medium bodied. Actually quite good. "India pale lager" - as widdershins this moniker might sound, fits the bill better than Zwickel...
Bottle at home. Slightly hazy golden ale, white foamy head. Nicely floral hoppy nose and taste, grassy and fruity too, light but grainy malty base. Short finish. Medium carbonation and body.
Mooie oranje gele kleur met een volle kraag. Ruikt fruitig, hop, honing. Smaakt lekker bitterzoet, hop, honing. Honingzoete bittere afdronk.
nice hop in the aroma looks golden yellow foam sticks to the glass taste pleasant bitterness soft mouthfeel very nice pilsner
Very good Landbeer, which due to itÂ’s nice and hoppy aroma refers to IPAÂ’s.
Hazy copper colour. Strongly hopped but well balanced. Nice herbal and floral aroma.

On tap, 2dl tasting glass @ Amsterdam Craft Beer Festival 2015. Body is hazy orange, head is big, offwhite, rocky, fully lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is slightly malty, flavor is orange peel, malt, light spices. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Finish is medium lasting hoppy medium bittersweet. Medium body, sticky dry texture, average carbonation. Easy, refreshing, good simple beer.

Clear warm golden colour, white head. Slightest haze. Hoppy aroma, straw, lemon peel, herbal hops. Light bitter flavour, quite fruity, bit sweet. Sweet, light bitter finish, straw, quite fruity. Decent beer with a nice hop profile.(from 33cL bottle @ home)
Aardachtige steenachtige plantachtige zoetende geur. Licht (niet geheel) heldere kleur. Wolkige schuimkraag. Hoppige smaak.

30 cl bottle in Limburg, fresh. Golden to light amber color, hazy. Rocky, uneven white head, sticky, leaving good lace. AromaÂ’s: Wet hop, herbal hop, light grain. Retronasal: herbal and aromatic hops, light grain. Flavor: light sweet, malty, just a hint of bitterness. Light bodied, but certainly not thin. Long finish with a delicate bitterness. Clean and good, but due to the enthusiastic previous ratings I expected a bit more - bitterness notably.

The beer has a nice orange color. A beautiful orange color, slightly cloudy. The beer has a beautiful layer of creamy white foam. The beer has a delicious smel. The aromaÂ’s are those delicious citrusy hop aromaÂ’s. Really refreshing. Those aromaÂ’s are presented in the taste. The citrusy hop flavor is perfect. Nice and sweet, bitter, beautiful soure tastes of the citrus fruits. Very nice taste. It is nice that the bitterness is milder than in, for example, IPA. This makes it possible to drink the beer together with a sweet snack.

Draft at Hoppzak, Den Haag. Pours very hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of fruits, citrus, light cheesy hops and biscuity malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Light medium bodied with light carbonation.
Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts spicy citrus and hops flavor malts spicy citrus fruits and hops
2015-04-18 - This is a surprisingly nice Dutch beer. It has a very great hop taste.
Troebel donker oranje kleurig bier met schuim. Smaak is hopig bitter en fruitig, abrikoos, perzik. Fles heeft inmiddels een ander etiket waarop dit bier als een IPA wordt omschreven

0,33l Flasche. Goldenes trÃ¼bes Bier mit schnell schwindender Schaumkrone. Riecht angenehm fruchtig. Schmeckt malzig, leicht fruchtig nach Mandarine, zum Schluss angenehm bitter nach Hopfen. Harmonisch!

30cl flesje via AH, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 6%
Uitgeschonken in Kaapse Brouwers glas

Uiterlijk: goudoranjekleurig met dikke witte schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: hoppig, bloemig, fruitig als perzik, redelijk bitter in nadronk

Conclusie: valt me niet tegen deze IPA

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dubbed an Â’India pale lagerÂ’, this is apparently a pale lager hopped in the same way as an IPA - which makes me wonder how this can be classified as a Zwickelbier, Kellerbier or Landbier, IÂ’d rather place it under the new wave of hoppy Â’boutique PilsenersÂ’, to quote Martyn Cornell... Anyway, it shows a pretty, clear, deep Â’old goldÂ’ colour with quiet sparkling, under an irregularly structured, lightly lacing, egg-white head. Adding the deposit makes it completely hazy, IÂ’m beginning to see the resemblance with a Kellerbier after all...  Aroma has lots of citrussy hops, with impressions of mandarin, lemon zest, pink grapefruit flesh, bitter honey, hemp, white grape peel, tulips, white pepper, something faintly buttery and bread dough. Taste begins with a kind of Â’malt fruitinessÂ’, subduedly sweetish, minerally and slightly buttery, a bit metallic, with spicy hops creeping in already and increasing towards the finish, supported by a straightforward pale malt sweetishness, a little bit bready; the citrussy, spicy and leafy, fairly complex hop bitterness persists for quite a long time, drying the throat but still remaining relatively gentle. Very quenching and in any case more interesting than the regular pale lagers of Gulpener or any other Dutch brewery. Still, I miss the yeasty fruitiness of a top-fermented IPA so I am still unsure whether these new Â’IPLsÂ’, if they are to be considered as a subgenre of Pilsener or pale lager, really add something new to the world of beer styles...

(bottle 0.3l/ half of bottle, different label) Trade with Countbeer, thanks. Golden, a bit hazy colour. Small, white, fast falling head. Minimal lacing.Light body, watery texture, moderate carbonation. Aroma:A bit sweet, medium hoppy, tropical fruits, mango, citrus, soft grain, pale malt, hay. Taste: Moderate bitterness, medium tropical fruits,soft grain. Medium long, hoppy, light to medium bitter finish. High drinkability.

Taste @ home on wed. 18.03.Â’15, available at the Albert Heijn supermarkets. 
Light hazy darkgolden color, with a nice frothy head. 
Aroma: fruits very hoppy, hints of citrus, yeast notes,grains. Medium body. Taste: bit sweet, fruit touch, yeast, lovely bitter and refreshing.
Good. Summer beer
terrible beer, taste of honey and old hops. heavy round mouthfeel, lacks freshness. drank at home from bottle 22march15

Orange brown beer, transparent, with lots of yeast chunks floating around.
Smell is malty cherries and pears, honey, with hints of thime(?). Interesting.
Sweet bitter taste with a lightly astringent finish. Honey dominates quite a bit but is offset beautifully by the orange peel dryness.

Na veel positieve reviews hier ook maar eens geprobeerd. Veel me dik tegen, als je de echte IPA's gedronken hebt is deze nogal slap, bitterheid en nasmaak is erg snel weg

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Optik: Strohgelb opal, Schaum schnell zerfallend
Aroma: etwas Frucht, Hefe
Geschmack: auch hier etwas Frucht, aber nicht zu viel, stattdessen Aromen von Getreide. Das Bier klingt mit einer schÃ¶nen aber recht eintÃ¶nigen Bitterkeit ab.

Pours slightly hazy golden with a nice frothy head. Very hoppy, grassy, pine-like and soapy aroma with some hits of citrus, some grains, barley and yeast and some small malty notes. Fair. Taste is moderately sweet and bitter and works out pretty refreshing. Beginning with a nice sweetish yeasty kick, nice bitterish middle, evolving towards a nice, fresh, herbal, slightly tarty finish in which the fruits live up very well. Tasty in quite a surprising and impressive way. Medium bodied, with a bit of a creamy mouthfeel. Truly an enjoyable brew, +1 for being an easy to find one, which is abundantly available at the Albert Heijn supermarkets at a more than decent price.

0,33 l bottle from Albert Heijn, best before end of april 2015. Clear, golden orange with a small, frothy, slowly diminishing, white head. Typical IPA-ish, fruity aroma of citrus, tangerine and orange with a malty background of grains, bread and biscuits. Very interesting, sweetish and fruity taste of the mentioned fruits while the malts create flavours of grains, bread and biscuits. Good! Crisp, slightly bitter and fruity finish without the often harsh grapefruit attack. That causes a very smooth mouthfeel. Medium body, soft carbonation. Quite unusual but definitely worth drinking. Good balance between malts and hops. Fresh, not overly bitter and smooth.

The next IPA from a bigger Dutch brewerÂ… And you might think: well, another one, same stuff, another nameÂ… But no, this one is different! ItÂ’s not only that it is organic, itÂ’s also that due to the Gulpener promis of using local ingredients, this IPA comes with Hallertauer, Smaragd and Cascade hops. This takes the crisp fruitiness of IPAs brewed with Amarillo e.g., but gives a new idea of IPA. Much dryer, some tobacco hints, spicy sour backtaste, a light body and a sticky dru finish. I like this interpretation of an IPA!
The Dutch interpretation of an IPA. Something you need to taste!

Bottle thanks to CountBeer, thanks! Pours a golden yellow with a shortlived white head that recedes to a sheen. Aroma is bready malts and some lemon citrus. Taste is bready, slightly sweet with a long bitter finish.

bottle from the supermarket some time ago, deep yellow to golden colour with a white head, malts, orange, floral, grains, citrus, nice carbonated, nice fruity taste, this itÂ’s why gulpener is still the best family brewery of the netherlands

33cl bottle. @home 29-12-2014.
Courtesy of RW80. Many thanks!
BBD: Mei 15.
In short: malty lager.
Pours quite clear deep golden with nice white head. Short head retention, poor lacing, Malty, sweet, some skunky and boiled vegetables aromas. Light to medium body, average carbonation, some oily texture. Taste is quite malty sweet, some fruity, caramel, and also some off flavours, cooked vegetables.
Golden body and huge softly hazy looks. Very hoppy, fresh, surprising. Good pale malt backup. Taste is accessible but unmistakably ipa. Honest surprise ! (33cl bottle from AH in Leiden)
Pours a golden slightly unclear beer with a good white head. Smells fruity, hops and fresh. Tastes fruity, malts, hops. Nice. Average carbo, thin body and a dry texture.
Once turned in accordance with label. Showing cloudy beer with white foam head. Hop aroma and hoppy taste. Okay beer.

On stock in most local supermarket in the area. Hazy orange color with thick white head, lacing. Herbal nose. Aroma is grains, sweet malts with herbs. Flavour is about the same with the herbal tones coming out with cirspy hoppiness. Very original rough beer, but very good.
I hope we meet again I am interested in your red cousin as well . Amazing

Bottle. Pours hazy gold with thin white head. Aroma full of hops, grapefruit and a hint of sweet malts. Really well balanced taste of interesting, fresh hops. Taste opens to a citrus aftertaste with lingering, sweet body. Great. Well-crafted combination of sweet power and rude creativity - just like Dutch soccer team, Me like.
Nice floral tones of the hallertau hops in the aroma giving it a more european character. Taste is bitter / sweet, fruity, citrus, peach. Medium body, good carbonation. Actually a very good beer.

Drinking blind from a 33cl bottle.
In the aroma hop, metal, peach and alcohol.
The unclear orange beer has a medium off-white head
The taste is sweet, fruity with hops in it.
Medium carbonated.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden yellow beer with a small white head on top. Aroma is grainy, malty, hoppy light citric. Flavor is medium bitter, quite hoppy and very crisp. Nicely balanced with a decent carbonation going on here. Aftertaste is medium long and quite bitter. Decent stuff!!
Bottle @ home. Aroma is citrus and herbal hops, hint of caramel. Promising. Flavour is nice and hoppy, fruity, light herbal. Note of caramel and grains. Great job Gulpener!
Kleine schuimkraag, Hop byte is vrij slap. afdronk wel snel weg. Al met al aardige niet te stevige ipa achtig biertje
Grassy hoppy Curtis aroma. A tiny bit cloudy, not so much head. Nice fruity fresh hop aroma citrus/yellow fruits. Also a bit malty. Nice commercial pale ale brew.

Hazy yellow colour, small head. Aroma is sweetish with fruits, peaches, pumkin. tastes reasonable bitter, with also sweet fruits, grapefruit, peach, nectarine. Bitter finsih, long staying, short too medium finish. The hoppy bitterness remains. nice beer.

Appearance: cloudy golden with off-white head.
Aroma: nice hops, vague malt.
Taste: some sour, light bitter.
Palate: refreshing, medium bitter, medium CO2.
Overall: Very nice.

A hazy dark yellow body with a fluffy white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Nose has yeast, wheat, some funk and hay. Taste is quite dry with a slow bitter finish. Carbonation feels soft and the palate is just above medium. Quite nice, interesting and balanced.
at my home hazy golden blonde colored body with a white head and a spicy fruity malt hops aroma a spicy hop dry bitter taste with a dry bitter finish

Bottled (from biernavigatie). Hazy orange colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is grainy, bready and sweet maltiness with nice floral and herbal notes. All in a positive way this time. Flavour is sweet bready and grainy malts along with some floral, resiny and quite refreshing hoppiness to it. Very simplistic, and the grainy notes can be harsh to some, but I actually liked this beer a bunch. One of the surprises lately.

Donkergeel, enigzins troebel bier met een witte schuimkraag. Geur van mout en koekjes, smaak is hoppig met een lichte tint van rozewater en gedroogd fruit, een bitter-zoete smaak, met een hoppige afdronk. Wel aardig, maar ik ben beter gewend van Gulpener.
Awesome color and raw clearness... floral simple hops... sweet, ir lacks some bitterness.. some malts
Prima zoet kruidig aroma met sinaasappelschil, prima ongefilterd oranje troebel met plakkerige kraag, prima fruit bittere smaak met dito nasmaak.
Mooi bouquette van hop en gedroogd fruit. Smaak van hop, wierrook en tuttie-fruttie. Flesje gekocht bij de slijter.

11/VII/14 - 30cl bottle from Biernavigatie (webshop, NL) @ home - BB: XI/2014 (2014-787) 
Cloudy orange beer, creamy irregular yellowish off-white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: grassy, somewhat fruity, hint of exotic fruits, sweet malts, grains, hay. MF: ok carbon, medium to light body. Taste: sweet malts, bit fruity, citrus, exotic fruits, nice bitterness, bit sour. Aftertaste: some citrus, exotic fruits again, soft bitterness, little sweet. Very nice beer, this one! The cascade is keeping this thing straight up!

On tap at in the wildeman. Hazy gold pour with white head. Aroma is really hoppy, spicy noble hops, pineapple, woody notes, light malt. Taste is hoppy, really tasty, light bready honey malt notes. Really tasty. Palate is med-light bodied with good carbonation. Nice.

Draught @ Wildeman, Amsterdam.
Hazy golden, little head. Nicely fresh, earthy, lightly dry-hopped keller. Dry, nice, but 6% is a bit much for a Keller.

floral, orange, hazy, medium bitterness, long finish, bitter, sticky, 

ItÂ’s got a strong honey character lingering about. As far as organic beers are concerned, this one definitely stands out of the lot.
Drank 14/8/2014 during the holiday Rik, Lennart and Bram. Tastes like an IPA, very hoppy, slightly sweet also. Perfect carbonation, tingeling but soft.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma: floral, slightly skunky, lactose? Taste: floral, grass, light citrus, pine, resin. Light- medium sweet and bitter. Smooth, somewhat dry finish. Very nice, and excellent value for money.

Pours a murky orange/yellow colour with little carbonation and head.
Aroma is hoppy and some good citrus and grassy notes there.
Taste is quite a bit sweeter than IÂ’d have imagined, nice bitter and sweet notes with some great aftertaste.
Goes down very smooth, nice full body.

Cloudy, deepgolden coloured beer with a white head. Medium carbonation. The hops in this beer give it a slightly herbal and fruity flavour and aroma. Some citrus. Alls balanced out pretty good. GulpenerÂ’s best special beer.
Poured slightly hazy light amber with a frothy white head. Aroma of barnyard and floral hops, light lactose. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, medium sweet and lightly bitter.
Veel hopsmaak, weinig aroma, beetje bitterness. Leuke bekende hopsmaak: northern Brewer?

Opaque golden with decent lasting, lacing white foam head. Aroma is little hoppy, some citrus, some barley. Little nutmeg. Taste is nice, good bitter, some spices, some barley. Nice lasting aftertaste. Good. (Velp 201408)

UPDATED: APR 18, 2015 Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Hazy orange with a medium sized white head.
Aroma from the bottle is a mix of typical Gulpener aroma with some nice hop tones. Aroma from the glass is perfume, wood, hops, soap and herbs.
Flavours of hops, herbs, light grapefruit, light citrus, light nettle, some malts, light apricot, some bitters and grass.
Aftertaste is herbal, bitter, light fruity, light dry and light soapy.
Low carbo, light creamy mouthfeel, good medium bodied and a light dry light creamy texture.
Interesting beer! Great stuff!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

Blumig-frisch im Nachgeschmack, dabei leicht sÃ¼ÃŸlich. Muffig (Was aber gut passt), malzig, frisch und durch die leichte SÃ¼ÃŸe sehr sÃ¼ffig. Toll!

Hazy orange collor, with white head, medium carbonation.
Flavor is bitter, hops,citrus, well balanced.
Good bitter afther taste.
Nice one and not expensive.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2015 Bottle @ home. Hazy orange color, medium sized quickly diminishing off-white head. Aroma is malts and indeed hops. Taste malts, some hops, some yeast, lightly bitter. Decent body and carbonation. I quite like it. [Original rating: 7-3-8-3-15 (3.6)] Re-rate: awesome beer in its style, very nice light and refreshing beer. Like it even better this time around.

A nice, slightly orange beer with a firm steady layer of foam. A nice aroma of citrus fruits and hop. It tastes quite bitter, but you can also taste the other hops used in the brewing process. Nice subtile aftertaste!

Mooi, lichtjes oranje bier met een stevige witte kraag. Lekker aroma van citrusvruchten en hop. De smaak is voornamelijk bitter, maar er komen zeker tinten naar voren van de diverse hopsoorten. Lekkere subtiele nasmaak!
Bottle 0,3ltr: Hazy yellow/amber colored brew with nice dry bitter taste with fruity hints, the tastiest of their "Ur" series.

Sample from a keg.
Thin white head. Hazy golden blond pour. Lovely bitterness. Very good.

Bottle at home. Hazy golden pour, thin white head. Aroma of grassy hops, earl grey tea, citrus and a bit spicy. Flavor is bitter, loads of hops, well balanced, smooth and quite unique. Very nice beer, especially from a large brewery as Gulpener. Probably the best beer I can buy at my local supermarket right now.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours bit hazy orange with white head. 
Aroma malts, bread, some hops, some citrus. 
Taste nice little bitter kick, malty sweets. 
Mouthfeel bit dry, medium body. 
OK Brew.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 Orange coloured beer medium white head, hoppy pineapple citrus malts sweet caramel smell, medium carbonation and bitter peppery malty caramel taste in the distance some citrus but also some Â’dropÂ’/liquorise
UPDATED: MAR 2, 2017 Hoppy aroma of pale malt, citrus, herbal tea, grapefruit. Flavour is fruity and hoppy leading to a nicely bitter finish. Mildly sweetish and medium bodied. Quite a nice beer!
30 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ the local Albert Heijn supermarket. Hazy golden with a white head. Hoppy malty aroma and taste. Nice, inexpensive session beer.

Bottle 300 ml at home, poured into a big tulip. ABV 6%
Slight hazy body, deep and bright golden orange coloured. Almost two fingers of white thick head, with good retention, leaving heavy lacing around the glass.
Aroma is of hops, yeasty, dust, grains.
Wow, very nice taste, quite hoppy, very citrusy, a bit sweet with honey notes on the finish, but the hops are coming back on the aftertaste with a nice long lasting bitterness. A bit of grass too.
Medium thin body, soft carbonation.
Overall a very nice beer, I got it from the local beer store but I hear itÂ’s available on the supermarkets too.When the AH Bio Pilsner came out from them it was also great but it went downhill from there, so I hope this one stays as good as it is now.

Bottled. Already 2 33cl samples today. (Yes I have a day off). Bought in my local supermarket for a price so extremely low. The aroma is slightly German like, grassy, some skunky hops and citrus, some grainy/honey tones. Slightly hazy, golden coloured with a lasting, white head. The taste is light-moderate bitter (wow achieving moderate bitterness in a beer I can get in a dutch supermarket) grassy hoppy, bit citric, some honey. Clean, nice and dry. Very refreshing. Guess this will be my WK 2014 beer. As said by others, bit a pitty of the marketing non-sense to put the bottle on the top to get the yeast left overs mixed up in the beer. (They put some letter upside down to give you some more motivation). Anyway apart from that, itÂ’s been a long time since I rated a dutch macro this high. But it is deserved. And as some critic to one of the raters below... If you think a student did a decent exam would you consider giving him a 4.8 out of 10? Really... Get your ratings straight.
bottle at home, hazy golden beer with a medium head, aroma was hoppy, taste was also hoppy, overall a nice beer.
Lager beer with a bit more hops than usual. Should be unfiltered, but is quite clear. Decent.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2015 Bottled from local supermarket. Slightly hazy golden colored, white head. Hoppy nose, grainy, keller-like, quite Â’GermanÂ’. Hoppy flavor, bitterness with quite some malty backbone, hay, medium to thick body. IÂ’m pretty impressed, this is a very tasteful yet easy to drink beer. And itÂ’s available in almost every supermarket. Did not expect such a quality brew from such a (relatively) big brewery, although they do produce some other fine brews (Chateau Neubourg and especially Mesteechs Aajt). Ranks high among my favorite session beers. Keep up the good work guys!

Bottle 30cl. shared
Appereance: Hazy golden color, good creamy head (Slightly more then 1 finger on a small tasting glass.)
Aroma: Grass, with hints of Citrus (Grapefruit and Lemon)and a hint of yeast.
Taste: Grass and Citrus (Grapefruit and Lemon)) medium bitter with a light sweetness.
Medium body, sticky texture,average carbonation.


This was much better then expected. Was served at "Happen met een bier in Hoogeveen" incombination with apserges and a sauce with musard and dill.
Which worked very nicely good stuff at the Lekkernije.

Good brew from Gulpener, I ill pick this up once more.
(Good alternative to promote more hoppy beers in a easy good way.)

UPDATED: APR 23, 2015 30cl Bottle from AH. Hazy golden yellow colour, white head. Aroma of bread, unmalted barley, some wort, grassy and light-spicy hops. Flavour is medium-sweet, malty, bread, barley, honey, some lemon, decent grassy hoppy bitter finish with a hint of herbal bitterness. Light-bodied. Nice. 747314 Re-rate: had this a few times now, also from tap, and itÂ’s just a really good beer. They call it an IPL now, but thatÂ’s just surfing on the IPA-hype. Whatever. Tap version is even more hoppy and honey-ish. 848316

Hazy light amber with big fluffy white head. Medum malty with slight toasted note, grapefruit, lime peel, lots of herbal notes. Taste is light sweetness with medium bitter kicking in halfway and slighty dry bitter finish. Medium bodied. Pretty decent stuff, this is actually hoppy unlike most other major "hoppy" beers. Nothing too exciting but the best Gulpener beer IÂ’ve ever had.
0,lelies bij de Appie vandaan. Mooi oranjegoud bier met een pittig hop aroma en een mooie volle bitterzoete smaak. Afdronk is dik in orde. Hopbier is nu ook in de supermarkt verkrijgbaar.

Bottle from Albert Heijn in Leerdam. The beer has a hazy golden color and a large white head, with a lot of bubbles. In the aroma tones of citrus, flowers, hops and some tropical fruits. The taste is fruity and hoppy, is a little sweet and nice medium bitter. The finish is dry and hoppy. Finally, I real good beer from Gulpener, about time.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2014 Bottled from Mitra Bunnik, BB Nov 14, large sample, served in a shaker. Pours a slight hazy golden color, medium frothy slight off-white head. Aroma of quite some noble hop, slight spicy, bit grassy, slight grainy. Medium bitter in taste, some hay and grass. Lots of marketing nonsense on the label, but the beer itself is wonderful and doesnt match with the corny label. Lovely german styled classic.

30cl bottle shared with friends. Slightly pale orange with a medium white soapy head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Bitter with some sweet tones. Citrus, grass, grapefruit and some herbs. A nice refreshing bitter brew.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2014 Bottle 30cl. Hazy golden color, generous creamy off-white head, good retention and lacing; grassy hop nose, yeasty, citrus, lemon; fresh medium bitter taste, just a hint of sweetness; medium body, sticky texture; crisp bitter finish. Rerated 141115: 0.2 point extra, this is simply a very nice refreshing beer.
Bottle. Golden color, hazy. Grassy aroma and flavor with a hint of citrus, Medium bodied, malty. The flavor of fresh German hops. Surprisingly good.
